data:
>
    
  
    
      Bradley W. Filippone Bradley W. Filippone Francis L. Moseley Professor of Physics Contact information for Bradley W. Filippone MC 356-48 360 Lauritsen Laboratory 626-395-4517 bradf@caltech.edu Research Website Personal Website B.S., Pennsylvania State University, 1977; M.S., University of Chicago, 1979; Ph.D., 1982. Research
Fellow, Caltech, 1983-84; Assistant Professor, 1984-90; Associate Professor, 1990-95; Professor,
1995-2016; Moseley Professor, 2016-. Research Interests Experimental Nuclear Physics & Low Energy Particle Physics. Presently I am using new technologies to trap free neutrons for use in symmetry tests of the electroweak standard model. In particular we are building an experiment to search for new sources of Charge-Parity (CP) symmetry violation in the form of a permanent electric dipole moment for the free neutron. Experimental Nuclear Physics & Low Energy Particle Physics. Presently I am using new technologies to trap free neutrons for use in symmetry tests of the electroweak standard model. In particular we are building an experiment to search for new sources of Charge-Parity (CP) symmetry violation in the form of a permanent electric dipole moment for the free neutron.
